caption: Sushi is my favorite food. I've eaten copious amounts of the good struff in The USA and Japan. This is the best sushi I have ever had. It's expensive but worth it. The cocktails are also very good and the setting is great too. But the 5 …

Hands down the best sushi I ever had. Was a very personal experience with just you and the chef. Chef David was amazing. Pleasant to conversate with and accomadates to your needs if you have any specific requests. Went there with a friend, came back the next day. Definitely worth the money (its pricey but it's worth it!).
Best sushi!
Amazing experience.  Andrew did a great job and the fish was very fresh.

(Translated by Google) They ruined a legend !! bartender that water down the cocktails, manager of the bar who despite asking him does not wear a mask, they load you drinks that you have not consumed and make you pay the tip twice !! Below …

Yikes! The worst restaurant experience EVER. The sushi quality is the lowest. The chef is a joke. You tell him you don’t eat/allergie to a certain white fish, his answer is “too bad I don’t have anything else for you” and the bill costs you …
Amazing food! AmaZing quality of fish! Andrew is the best chef there ever is!

Honestly in addition to being rushed through each course, I was expecting more from quality. Overwhelming fishy taste to some plates (my reaction of: I’m not sure fish is suppose to be this color. - was met with an eye roll). There are much better places to get sushi in Miami!

(Translated by Google) Wonderful Omakase experience, I loved the concept. Great service, excellent sushi quality, and amazing cocktails. A hidden gem within the old Versace Mansion.  (Original) Maravillosa experiencia de Omakase, me encantó …

Proud of our creation. While i am biased, i do feel this is one of the best foodie experiences you will ever have. Besides offering guests the most fresh fish Miami has to offer.(flown in daily from all over the world), the setting in the …

AMAZING EXPERIENCE - from start to finish - this spot has earned every star in here! I came in with a big group of friends, we decided to arrive early and actually enjoyed delicious drinks in their lounge (which used to be Gianni's old …

I'm a big fan of great hospitality (hard to come by in Miami) and this location is the epitome of that. Aside from being located inside of the Versace Mansion, the staff was super attentive and friendly and the fish was the best I've had in South Florida. I had a lot of fun while enjoying amazing food with my friends.

Went here a few weeks back while I was in Miami on business and needed a nice dinner out. The staff was amazing! Bartender made me a custom cocktail before my meal, and the host was incredibly gracious. The chef was super accommodating of my dietary restrictions, and was also so friendly and knowledgeable. Can't wait to visit again!
I loved the intimate idea of this dinner concept.  Food was amazing, there's a true feeling of exclusivity and there is that feeling of adventure finding the actual restaurant within the hotel.

The drinks before and the sushi was incredible. We had a sweet couple sitting next to us and we chatted with them and our chef and it was a memorable experience. I would have gladly given 5 or more stars. However, after we were done with …
I strongly advise not to come here! The food was quality but you barley had time to swallow it before tthe next course.  55 minutes is way to quick for a 17 course $200 meal, would not recommend!!!!!

If you want a fine dining "experience," this is definitely not the place for you, especially knowing it is $200 a person.  The food was great, but we were rushed out the door, and flat out told to leave after 55 minutes!! no wonder the chef is leaving.

The most incredible dining experience. This is just what it is... an 'experience'. Dining inside the Versace mansion at a private omakase bar (limited to 6 seats) is AMAZING. The quality is top notch and unbeatable. I highly recommend this unique experience at an inconic venue and dining inside of the Gianni Suite!

Booked David Bou for our group for Omikaze and were definitely not disappointed. David is an unexpected Sushi Master who bares the same humility, skill, and at the same time pride for the beautiful work he does. Absolutely hilarious, …

The sushi was great BUT for the price we are paying it's not worth it to be rushed through our meal. The hostess ran us up the stairs, told us nothing about the Mansion, didn't tell us who would be seating us/where we would sit/how things …
